page.title: 03THE VILLAGE PANTOMIME
page.content: The pantomimes in Hollingbourne started in 1979 after a successful Old Time Evening. The first village pantomime was written by Dr.Derek Manners and the music composed by Dr. Peter Bonds, both of whom live and practice in the village. Over the years they have taken it in turns to write and produce pantomimes and Dr. Bonds has contributed all the songs and music. Many villagers are involved over the six months of production in scenery, costumes, acting and props. The five performances are attended by a total audience of 600 people and all the profits are presented to the Village Hall. The planned pantomime for 1986 is Robinsoe Crusoe In Space. A thriving village drama group has developed from the pantomimes.
